discussion.content:
correct:
Long Answer
Rating
Multiple Response
Ranking
Net Promoter Score

in Customer Voice:
Open-ended question - Text
How many stars - Rating
Choose all that apply - Choice question (with multiple answers on)
Put these things in the order of importance - Ranking
How likely are you to tell your friends about us - NPS
now we have Customer Voice :) I would say: 12345

comments.content: Not really, according to the updated document, Smile rating is under rating.

discussion.content:
Smile rating will also an option instead of Net Promoter Score.
Besides this, the question is outdated.
Voice of the Customer was deprecated July 1, 2020. We now use MS Forms Pro.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You are creating a survey using a Dynamics 365 for Marketing Surveys. You need to include multiple question types.
Which survey question types presents the best choice for each scenario/example presented? To answer, drag the appropriate survey question to the scenario/ example. Each survey question type may be used once, more than once or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view the content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Of Course ACE
A. Define an objective for your survey so that you can ensure that all questions serve that objective.
B. Make your surveys long so that you customers can get a chance to provide as much information as possible. (Long surveys will always tend to have a very low participation score and a high drop-out rate during the Survey)
C. Be sure to mention the estimated time to complete, along with a brief overview in your invitation.
D. Previewing or testing your survey is unnecessary because your survey tool will automatically catch errors.(Previewing and testing your survey, will be a key element in avoiding errors in design and reporting errors you have made. The tool will not do any typing error analysis, it does not have enough artificial intelligence to guess the nonsense.)
E. Try to organize the survey in a way that groups all related questions together in sections.

Correct answer : A-C - E in this case
Someone has the new link to the documentation?

choices.E: Try to organize the survey in a way that groups all related questions together in sections.
choices.A: Define an objective for your survey so that you can ensure that all questions serve that objective.
choices.D: Previewing or testing your survey is unnecessary because your survey tool will automatically catch errors.
choices.C: Be sure to mention the estimated time to complete, along with a brief overview in your invitation.
choices.B: Make your surveys long so that you customers can get a chance to provide as much information as possible.

questions.question_text:
You are creating a customer survey and you want to get good responses.
You need to analyze the responses to provide actions to best suit your organization.
Which three responses are considered best practice? (Choose three.) Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.B: Turn on track email in the distribution settings.
choices.C: Add the Email variable in the Personalization customization.
choices.A: Enable the Anonymous responses in the distribution settings.
choices.D: Turn on the toggle for Save value in the Email variable.

comments.content: assuming "to capture the Email" and email variable is "email address", if it was "First name" then it may be D. It just struck me now that they did not detail enough if they mean the "email address"

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-voice/personalize-survey email is not a default personalisation value: "By default, the following variables are available:

First Name: Inserts the first name of the recipient.

Last Name: Inserts the last name of the recipient.

locale: Specifies the locale of the survey while embedding it in the email. More information: Embed a survey in an email"

discussion.content:
Why save the email for anonymous responses, isn't that a contradiction? You may argue that an email address is not an identification but we are not used to indicate social security numbers instead of email for identification (which means email is identification of a respondent)
"Anonymous responses: Specify whether to record respondents' names, or keep them anonymous.

By default, this setting is turned off and the respondent's name is recorded.

When you turn on this setting, the respondent's first name, last name, and email aren't saved in response records by default. If you've added variables to your survey, their values also will not be stored in response records by default." https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-voice/distribution-settings

Selected Answer: D
I would say that the given answer is correct because in the question there is mentioned "during survey variable configuration".

Selected Answer: C
Correct answer is C. There is no existing variable for email so it needs to be created manually.

questions.question_text:
You are a functional consultant working with Dynamics 365 Customer Voice.

You are tasked with planning a survey that will be distributed for anonymous response.

Which action is required during survey variable configuration to capture the Email of the anonymous respondent?

comments.content:
I agree except for the first one.I suppose:
1. Multiple Response (choose one)

no! You can accept multiple answers for your question by turning on the Multiple answers toggle. Respondents choose one or more answers from the list by selecting one or more check boxes. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-voice/available-question-types#rating

discussion.content:
There is no question type called numerical or fixed sum.

Answer should be:
1. Single Response
2. Rating - rating question can have a custom score applied out of 100, weighted differently against each of the 5 rating options
3. Single Respone - restriction can be applied to this question type to only accept numerical values

questions.question_text:
You are the marketing manager at Contoso, Ltd. Your team has created a survey and sent out the link through email for responses.

You want to understand the outcome from the Satisfaction Metrics report and identify the metrics created by default in Dynamics.

For the metrics, what are the three charts created by default in Dynamics? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
